contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Uncle Anesthesia | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Screaming Trees]] | Cover = Screaming Trees Uncle Anesthesia.jpg | Released = January 29, 1991 | Recorded = June 1990 | Genre = [[Grunge]], [[neo-psychedelia]] | Length = 47:05 | Label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | Producer = [[Screaming Trees]], [[Terry Date]], [[Chris Cornell]] | Last album = ''[[Something About Today]]''<br />(1990) | This album = '''''Uncle Anesthesia'''''<br />(1991) | Next album = ''[[Anthology: SST Years 1985-1989]]''<br />(1991) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{rating|3|5}}<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web|title=allmusic ((( ''Uncle Anesthesia'' > Review )))|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r17589|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|author=Rivadavia, Eduardo|accessdate=March 17, 2010}}</ref> |rev2 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' |rev2score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref>Brackett, Nathan. "Screaming Trees". ''The New Rolling Stone Album Guide''. November 2004. pg. 721, cited March 17, 2010</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Uncle Anesthesia''''' is the [[Screaming Trees]]' fifth album and first full-length album release on [[Epic Records]], released on January 29, 1991. It includes two of the four tracks from the band's previous Epic release, 1990's ''[[Something About Today]]'' EP, including the song that would give the LP its title. The album, recorded throughout June 1990, was the last to feature drumming by original member [[Mark Pickerel]], who left on amicable terms in [[1991 in music|1991]] to work in a variety of projects. He would be replaced by [[Barrett Martin]]. ''Uncle Anesthesia'' was co-produced by noted [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] specialist [[Terry Date]] and [[Soundgarden]] vocalist [[Chris Cornell]]. Despite the major label backing, the album failed to expand the Trees' audience beyond its existing fanbase. However, "Bed of Roses" was released as a single and became a minor hit on the Modern Rock charts. ==Track listing== {| class="wikitable" ! # ! Song ! Length |- |01 |"Beyond This Horizon" |<center>4:13</center> |- |02 |"Bed of Roses" |<center>3:02</center> |- |03 |"Uncle Anesthesia" |<center>3:52</center> |- |04 |"Story of Her Fate" |<center>1:41</center> |- |05 |"Caught Between" |<center>5:03</center> |- |06 |"Lay Your Head Down" |<center>3:32</center> |- |07 |"Before We Arise" |<center>2:26</center> |- |08 |"Something About Today" |<center>3:02</center> |- |09 |"Alice Said" |<center>4:11</center> |- |10 |"Time for Light" |<center>3:50</center> |- |11 |"Disappearing" |<center>3:12</center> |- |12 |"Ocean of Confusion" |<center>3:05</center> |- |13 |"Closer" |<center>5:48</center> |- |} All songs credited to [[Mark Lanegan]] and [[Gary Lee Conner]]. Tracks 2, 3 and 5 also credited to [[Van Conner]]. ==Personnel== * [[Mark Lanegan]] - Vocals * [[Gary Lee Conner]] - Guitar, Backing Vocals * [[Van Conner]] - Bass, Backing Vocals * [[Mark Pickerel]] - Percussion, Drums * [[Chris Cornell]] - Recorder, Backing Vocals, Producer * Terry Date - Backing Vocals, Producer, Engineer * Scott Miller - Backing Vocals * Terry Pickerel - Percussion * Jeff McGraph - Trumpet * David Coleman - Art Direction * Karen Mason - Photography * [[Mark Ryden]] - Artwork * Screaming Trees - Producer ==Charts== '''Singles''' - Billboard (North America) {| class="wikitable" !Year !Single !Chart !Position |- |1991 |"Bed of Roses" |Modern Rock Tracks |align="center"|23 |} == External links == *[http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0000027E0/ Amazon Listing] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Screaming Trees}} [[Category:Screaming Trees albums]] [[Category:1991 albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Chris Cornell]] [[Category:Albums produced by Terry Date]] [[Category:Epic Records albums]]
